abstract.para: The &cockpit; web console allows you to view, filter, and manage virtual machines (VMs), storage pools, and networks. You can also use this interface to import existing VMs and activate, deactivate, and delete your virtualization resources.

section.title: Modifying a virtual machine configuration
section.para: To modify a virtual machine configuration,

step.para: Navigate to the Virtual machines page.

listitem.para: To modify the Memory, click edit and change the storage and memory and click Save.
To modify the Boot order, click edit and select the up and down arrow to set the boot order and click Save.
To modify the Watchdog device type, click edit, select the action and click Save.
Watchdogs act when systems stop responding. To use this virtual watchdog device, the guest system also needs to have an additional driver and a running watchdog service.
Reset performs a hard reset of the VM.
Power off shuts down the VM. Use this if a hung VM might cause data corruption on shared storage.
Inject a non-maskable interrupt when the watchdog timer expires, the hypervisor sends an non-maskable interrupt (NMI) signal to the virtual processor.
Pause suspends the VM in its current state. This allows an administrator to verify VM for debugging before manual recovery.
Do nothing records the event in the host logs but takes no physical action on the VM.
To modify the Vsock, click edit and modify or remove the custom identifier.
Virtual socket support enables communication between the host and guest over a socket. It still requires special vsock-aware software to communicate over the socket
To modify the Firmware, click the firmware name, select the required firmware from the drop-down list, and click Save.

section.title: Importing a virtual machine
section.para: To import a virtual machine, proceed as follows:

step.para: Navigate to the Virtual machines page and click Import VM.
In the Details section, specify the following details:

listitem.para: Enter a name for the VM.
Select the Connection as either System or User session.

note.para: Click the information icon next to Connection to view details on the available options.

listitem.para: Select the disk image located on the host file system.
Select the appropriate operating system and memory.

step.para: Define the Storage parameters, including the storage limit and memory.
To run the VM after importing, click Import and run.
To edit the VM parameters after importing, click Import and edit.
Modify the parameters and click Import and run.
